subject: Public Speaking
title: The Sophists: Rhetoric's Controversial Founders
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Sophists: Rhetoric's Controversial Founders.

hook.text: The Sophists were ancient Greece's first paid speaking coaches. Plato hated them. Aristotle respected some of it.

buildup.text: They taught anyone who could pay to argue both sides of any issue. Truth mattered less than winning.

discovery.text: Protagoras claimed there are two sides to every question. Gorgias argued language creates reality, not just describes.

twist.text: Plato attacked them as liars for hire. But their insightâ€”that framing shapes perceptionâ€”is now mainstream psychology.

climax.text: The Sophists were right about power: whoever controls the story controls the outcome. That's still true today.

punchline.text: They sold persuasion. The world never stopped buying.

quiz.question: Why did Plato criticize the Sophists?
options: They taught persuasion without regard for truth
